website_summaries.verdict: With durability that mirrors that of a nylon bag, this low-priced, soft cargo bag is suitable for occasional travelers.
pros: Padded with felt to prevent scratching
cons: Roof bars must be purchased separately

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Its really huge inside. Bigger than you'll think. It fastens well but it could use some sort of stiffening inside to provide shape. If not jam-packed full, it flaps in the wind. Fasteners are of great quality. Didn't encounter much rain. Took in inside the car after two days and gas milage improved.
customer_reviews.author: K. Lyman

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: The RackSack arrived the day before we were leaving on vacation. After reading other reviews, we used Scotch Guard to help keep bugs from sticking and to improve the water resistance. We stuffed the RackSack full of bags and gear for a three hour trip into Wisconsin. We had heavy rain for half of the trip and fully expected to find everything wet. We were pleasantly surprised to find very little moisture had made it through to the inside. It is easy to attach and the strap holders prevented the loose end from flapping. The included storage bag completes the package. I would recommend this to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Cycle Dad

customer_reviews.title: Dry and quiet
customer_reviews.text: drove 750 miles through rain and shine, and this bag performed admirably. At the end of the trip, contents were perfectly dry. Driving 80+ mph on I-95 for hundreds of miles, and it made minimal noise, much less than to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Slackerdad

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, wish it was 100% waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Worked great, wish it was 100% waterproof. Lots of room, I had 5 carry-on size suite case's, two tackle boxes, and still had room. Straps held it firmly in place no problems, on our 1800 mile trip. Fit perfectly on our Traverse. Would give it five stars if waterproof. I used a tarp inside bag for safe measures, drove through lots of rain and down Poor's onlhad 1 bag get damp that wasn't covered by tarp.
customer_reviews.author: greg

customer_reviews.title: Have had this 3 years now and love it.
customer_reviews.text: Go back and forth from Nevada to Washington each year. Have had this 3 years now and love it..holds so much and is easy to load and unload and then fold to put into storage until the next trip.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Vogel

customer_reviews.title: Very Reliable
customer_reviews.text: We have never owned anything like this, but we needed something to help because we had a long trip to go on and not very much room inside. We are very glad we purchased this, it is very reliable and easy to use. We didn't have any trouble with it at all. However, we did not leave it on top of the car when we stopped for the night. We also listened to advice of others and put our stuff in heavy plastic bags before putting it in the carrier. We are very satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: gweyn

customer_reviews.title: Sack is awesome. Definitely has plenty of space
customer_reviews.text: Sack is awesome. Definitely has plenty of space. We lined it with plastic in case it rained and that solved the water problem although it repels, it's not water proof. Great bag though all in all. Comes with a bag for storage too.
customer_reviews.author: Tim T.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in carrier.
customer_reviews.text: Bought in anticipation of holiday road trip. Held all of our luggage securely on drive to our destination., stored well while visiting our daughter and was easy to install and load for return trip. However we encountered rain on return drive. Our luggage got very wet and everything in it was damp. Several things got ruined. We had to unload carrier, bring luggage into hotel and open up in hopes to dry out our things, then reload for rest of trip. Drove from Florida to Michigan and back. Very dis-appointed in this. Can't always have rain free road trips. It sure didn't re-pell the water very well.
customer_reviews.author: patricia torchia

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This car top carrier worked easily and perfectly on a recent 2000 mile trip. It is easy to put on and take off the roof and has large zipper flaps to keep the weather out. We did not experience any heavy rain so its ability to be waterproof is an unknown to us. It did keep heavy dew off things though and light rain. Gas mileage was off about 20% though but we had to pack it as full as possible so there wasn't anything aerodynamic about it. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The great thing is ease of storage - versus a hard ...
customer_reviews.text: I put this on top of my 2014 Highlander. We took a family trip and drove 300 miles in sleet, rain and snow. All items arrived dry and in tact! I would buy again. The great thing is ease of storage - versus a hard top product.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, makes family trips so much better
customer_reviews.text: Pretty well doubled our capacity when taking family on trips. Its well made, easy to put on both our vehicles and with a little practice can be almost silent when driving at freeway speeds. The felt on the bottom has prevented any scratching on our roofs.
customer_reviews.author: C Graham

customer_reviews.title: We did not need it on the return trip so it packed inside very easily. Storage is no problem while not in use
customer_reviews.text: I have used the carrier one time since purchasing it. I used it on my outback and had no problems. i did borrow one from a friend before and no problems that time either. We had some rain on our travel to Charleston, SC and all items were dry upon arrival. We did not need it on the return trip so it packed inside very easily. Storage is no problem while not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Tom W.

customer_reviews.title: Everything we expected
customer_reviews.text: I had read reviews and already knew what to expect. It held up brilliantly thru our 2000+ mile road trip through rain, hail and high winds. We did pack all our belongings in plastic bags for added protection, but even those were dry. We noticed nothing significant in loss gas mileage; nor did we experience loud noise. The straps provided would probably have been sufficient but we added 3 extra tie downs just as precaution. I would definitely recommend this product to others.
customer_reviews.author: Roadwarrior

customer_reviews.title: Car top carrier
customer_reviews.text: We had no problems with our WeatherTech 60001 Rack sack when we went to the beach for a week. When not needed it can be stored very conveniently in its storage bag. It did not leak when we went through a rain storm. We are pleased also with its being so easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: agrill4u

customer_reviews.title: Exactlly what we needed
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a soft sided carrier for storage reasons. Folds up into a bag and can be stored anywhere. Drove from NJ to NC...much of the time in pouring rain and everything stayed dry. We took others advice and garbage bagged the suitcases but it wasn't necessary for us. Also, as suggested by others, made sure the zippers were around the back so rain was not pushed into the carrier. A little noisy when at high speed but opening the window a crack and hearing a little outside noise eliminated that. All in all a great purchase at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: Was surprised at the small box it came in, but it holds a lot and is sturdy and did exactly what we needed. Seems to be a quality product. We had no problems. When purchasing these it is important to consider the space you have on your roof. If you buy one with too much cubicle space it may have extra space that goes under the bar, you may even feel that you need to fill it up more just so it doesn't flop around. Don't buy much larger than you need thinking you're getting your money's worth. Buy the appropriate size. This is the appropriate size for us!
customer_reviews.author: LMatto

customer_reviews.title: Great product. It doesn't look as large but it ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. It doesn't look as large but it is huge. There is so much space that me and my 7 year old son were able to get in it at the same time. I'm 6'4" 260 lbs
customer_reviews.author: Latrick Turner

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, but not waterproof.
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality luggage carrier. We purchased this for a spring break trip to Florida and ran into rain the entire way there. Luckily we packed the suit cases inside of plastic bags however the clothing inside of the suitcases in the front, were still pretty wet. I like how it folds up and has a bag for storage. No need to store a huge hard cased plastic one all season. If rain is expected, I would consider wrapping clothing in plastic bags before putting them in the suitcase next time. Expect to have to pay more in fuel as it cut my gas mileage down by about 3 mph which adds up on a 3000 mile trip.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy S

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Well made. However clothing did get wet after we drove thru heavy rainstorm for half hour
customer_reviews.author: bill spade

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this product is much better than you can find at the local auto part store or the big box stores. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: KSmigiel

customer_reviews.title: Worked for what we needed; somewhat of a pain at night
customer_reviews.text: This was an economical fix for our excess luggage problem. We were able to stuff about 2 large suitcases and 2 small ones into the bag. We drove through two fierce rainstorms, and things were minimally wet. The only downside was that we had to unload it every night when we stayed at motels. The hard shell type can be locked and left. This type can be locked, but a sharp knife could cut the fabric easily to get to the contents. So unloading and reloading daily was a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: ANNEinAggieland

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We are a family of 5 and need more room than just the space provided in our van. It rained half of our 8 hour trip and nothing got wet because we put the zippered sides to the back and side of the van (as they recommend). It is a lot bigger than I thought it would be and just what we needed. It is a great product and would definitely recommend it to a friend!
customer_reviews.author: kb3

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely not water repellant
customer_reviews.text: Total waste of money!!!! Traveled across country and all my things were in plastic duffel bags in carrier , everything was wet and beginning to smell . Product was useless. Do not purchase !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: susan juliano

customer_reviews.title: i did use tie downs across the top to firm ...
customer_reviews.text: i did use tie downs across the top to firm it up so the wind wouldn't rattle the bag top. the bag held a lot of stuff which made it very heavy.it did the job.
customer_reviews.author: tl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Car Top Storage
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research on roof-top cargo carriers and selected the WeatherTech product mostly based on other Amazon reviews and the size, and I'm glad I did. It is very spacious and I was able to fit 3 carry-on suitcases along with other flexible items. The tie down straps work nicely and fold up as advertised. It never rained during our vacation trip so I don't have any feedback on water resistence. It folds nicely back into a storage pouch.
customer_reviews.author: vucats54

customer_reviews.title: Safe and secure
customer_reviews.text: I traveled over a thousand miles in very heavy rain and windy conditions. Everything was in good shape upon arriving at our destination. We put things in heavy duty plastic bags because it stated water resistant not waterproof. Very little change in gas mileage. It holds an amazing amount of luggage and thusly freed up a lot of space in vehicle. It was a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: mimon

customer_reviews.title: WeatherTEch60001 RackSack Bone Dry Reply
customer_reviews.text: Product keeps cargo dry and is easy to use. Takes up very little space when stored.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Burton

customer_reviews.title: WeatherTech Cargo Carrier
customer_reviews.text: This product works well. Easy to attach & very secure. The only issue is my items got wet in a very heavy downpour. I don't know if it was because I had the zippers exposed the wrong way. I haven't had a chance to test my theory as yet though. Best thing is you don't have to drive around with it on your roof all the time like the hard carriers.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Mason

customer_reviews.title: No problems!
customer_reviews.text: I used the WeatherTech to travel over 800 miles on the Interstate and had no problems whatsoever. It held a remarkable amount of items and was easy to load and zip shut.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Dogruyusever

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: The carrier was sturdy and easy to attach and take off the roof. It also held a lot of beach chair, didn't shift on the roof of my Explorer, and is easy to store when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: R. Shreve

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of space and the straps are great and strong
customer_reviews.text: Took this bag on a 1800 mile road trip and it was flawless. Plenty of space and the straps are great and strong.
customer_reviews.author: Diego Montealegre

customer_reviews.title: very nice product
customer_reviews.text: sturdy, well made, good clasps, is not weather proof but is weather resitsant. comes with a handy carry/storage case.
customer_reviews.author: ET

customer_reviews.title: secure and easy to assemble to tie down on roof
customer_reviews.text: Stable, roomy, secure and easy to assemble to tie down on roof. Very please! Well worth the $
customer_reviews.author: J Drayer

customer_reviews.title: NOT WATER PROOF
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big weather tech fan and love the floorliners. However, i'm very disappointed with this product. Got caught in some rain and everything was soaking wet. (and yes the zipper was in the back)
customer_reviews.author: DAClapperFam

customer_reviews.title: Weathertech  Awesome Carrier
customer_reviews.text: Love it!!!! Love it!!!! Purchased this carrier for our vacaton. This is our first ever car top carrier, and since we have no room to store a hardtop carrer, we decided to purchase the WeatherTech Roof Top Carrier!!! Was VERY easy to fill, held alot of suitcases plus odds and ends, especially with our family of six. Created so much more room in our van, I should've boughten one of these a long time ago. Would HIGHLY recommend this product to anyone. Folds up nice and neat in it's storage bag which is very handy!! Thanks again for a great product!!! L
customer_reviews.author: L. Barman

customer_reviews.title: my son and wife came to Alabama and loved it wished it was a bit larger but it ...
customer_reviews.text: my son and wife came to Alabama and loved it wished it was a bit larger but it came in really good with 2 grandchildren and a dog in a small suv!!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: WeatherTech RackSack
customer_reviews.text: I suggest you don't buy this item. I bought it about 2 weeks ago then went on a 800 mile trip to Colorado. The RackSack was easy to use but buy the time we got back it had basically come apart on the inside of the compartment. If you hit any wind at all the Sack also vibrates (the tie straps), you can help this by twisting the straps but it is still hard to keep all parts of it from flapping.
customer_reviews.author: GAB

customer_reviews.title: WaterProof?????
customer_reviews.text: Looked great when I bought it, had high hopes. Moved from MA to NY in pretty good rain, opened up the bag and everything was soaked from the bottom up. Not sure if it was because the felt bottom was in contact with the roof of the car, but AMAZON said this was recommended with the roof rack I purchased. Terribly dissapointed, I hate writing bad reviews, but I bought this because it was supposed to be WATERPROOF. Wish I could return it.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: They stand behind their products!
customer_reviews.text: When I have an exceptionally good experience with a company whose products I use, I just have to share it. I bought a WeatherTech cargo carrier over 10 years ago. It's a great product and we were very happy with it, until a friend borrowed it and broke one of the clips on the strap. I called WeatherTech and asked if I could purchase a clip. (All I really needed was the "male" end of one clip.) Their clasps have changed over the years and they no longer use the one I need, so they offered to send me a brand new RackSack Carrier! Now THAT'S a company who stands behind it's products!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for road trips
customer_reviews.text: Great for road trips with a golden retriever and twins in our Jetta Sportwagen. We encountered some rain but didn't notice anything was wet. We also purposely chose what we packed on top knowing this RackSack is resistant to rain but not waterproof. All in all, so easy, so convenient and an excellent purchase. We have suggested to many already!
customer_reviews.author: SLC

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Kept dry through the rain. Tightens down good. No movement.
customer_reviews.author: BigSig

customer_reviews.title: Amazon is not an authorized WeatherTech reseller
customer_reviews.text: Bag has been great until the zipper broke. Now WeatherTech will not warranty it because Amazon is not an authorized reseller.
customer_reviews.author: David Delahoz

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this held up good but when we went through a rain storm clothes inside got wet. Called weathertech they said it's not waterproof just water resistant. Would not spend this much money on it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my SUV for an 8 hour trip at Xmas. The extra space was wonderful. We traveled in 6 degree weather and the bag did not split or crack. It was easy to install. The zippers were smooth to close and the straps held the bag very secure to the roof rack. I decided to purchase this particular carrier based on the reviews from Amazon customers, and the price was a good deal. I do not have the space for a hard sided carrier. This folds up nice and stores in a drawstring bag!This is the first review I have posted on a purchased product, I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hesseltine

customer_reviews.title: roof carrier
customer_reviews.text: this product worked extremely well. Heavy material and strong zippers. Easy to put on roof with four straps. I put an extra one on for good measure, but it was unnecessary. Drove 7 hours each way, good weather, avg 65mph on the highway and it was fine. Being a flexible carrier, I was able to stick in a couple of odd shaped items at the last minute. This would never have worked on a rigid frame carrier.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Ruggiero

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a 16 hour drive in which we encountered rain. Seemed to be some minor penetration of water, but not a whole lot to speak of. We still put our luggage in garbage bags as a precaution. Otherwise, the straps held down well, and it was fairly easy to attach and detach to our luggage rack. It is nice that it folds up in to a small bag which is provided. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Carpenter

product_meta.title: WeatherTech 60001 RackSack Cargo Carrier
product_meta.description: The WeatherTechRackSack expands your cargo carrying capacity a whopping 13 cubic feet (measures 39" x 32" x 18"). Made of durable water repellent polyester, the RackSack stows away neatly in its own bag. Features include swivel straps that mount to the crossbar or side rails of an existing roof rack, patented Roll and Wrapâ„¢ tabs to prevent flapping straps, and a soft felt bottom to protect your vehicle's finish from scratching. PLEASE NOTE: For use only in conjunction with a cargo rack.
feature_bullets: Expands cargo carrying capacity 13 cubic feet
Made of durable water repellent polyester with soft felt bottom to protect finish of vehicle
Stows away neatly in its own bag
Swivel straps that mount to crossbar/side rails
Roll and wrap tabs to prevent flapping straps

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars60 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
